query.queryString: (/article/relations/categories/collection/code='resultsPack,projectsInfoPack,brief' OR (/result/relations/categories/collection/code='deliverable,publication' OR contenttype='project')) AND ('SUSTAINABILITY' OR 'INNOVATION' OR 'MULTI-CRITERIA')

category.description: Programme: Legal basis for research funding

result.title: Report on identified pleiotropic QTLs and potential underlying genes and pathways associated efficiency, resilience and reproduction related traits
result.description: In this deliverable, genomic and phenotypic data will be used to perform genome wide association analyses and identify QTLs that are associated with both efficiency- and resilience- related traits. Results will provide possible candidate genes and mechanism responsible for synergy and/or trade-offs under genetic control.

result.title: A report of an improved method to calculate genomic relationship across individuals of different purebred and crossbred populations
result.description: Joint multiple breed and crossbred genomic evaluations are not fully developed in small ruminants We will create a method to compute joint genomic relationships across individuals within a single breed across multiple breeds and across all possible crosses in a manner that genomic evaluations can generate the most accurate estimates of breeding values within and across populations profiting the information of all populations

result.title: A report for optimum contribution to manage diversity at critical regions and to assist mating design to maximise heterozygosity and expression of heterosis and evaluation of level inbreeding rate across genomic regions and their impact on performance
result.description: Genomic selection requires genomic management of diversity We will describe a method to first assess critical regions possibly carriers of deleterious recessive mutations and second maximize diversity in particular in those regions using optimal contributions and mate allocation

result.title: Brochure Community Museums in Portugal
result.description: Production of contents for the Web Portal from from MNA: a brochue specifically on the Portuguese case study, including: Social development and archaeological community landmarks; Community and sustainable museums: Portuguese and European paradigmatic examples; Community icons: Portuguese selected examples; Family, leaders and migrants stories: Portuguese selected examples (documents and interviews); From slavery to the abolition of the death penalty: Portugal and America, a history of giving and receiving (Illustrated text); Folk seasonal festivities: the world seen through masks.
